name: impermanently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that does not last forever, or does not last for a long time: It was often the case that the structures were too cheaply and impermanently built. The 55 million eligible voters include 11 million that work or live impermanently outside the region.
More examplesFewer examplesThey feel themselves to be only impermanently in town.More than two-thirds of people who used the service were impermanently housed.Immigration to South Africa from the rest of the continent was characterized by temporariness, as migrants were impermanently settled there.
